intro: Nassauvia pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf nassauvia, is a small, flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Nassauvia pygmaea is a low-maintenance plant that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil conditions.
